entries.title: Microsoft Surface Studio 2+ review: Elegant, flexible all-in-one PC gets an upgrade
entries.description: This premium AIO gets a new lease of life with processor and GPU updates, plus Thunderbolt 4 support. But has Microsoft gone far enough?

entries.title: Instagram is making it easier to get your account back if you've been hacked
entries.description: Lost access to your Instagram account? This web site might be able to help.

entries.title: Now you can join a Microsoft Teams call from a HoloLens 2 headset
entries.description: Microsoft pushes the industrial metaverse and also hints at what is coming next for HoloLens hardware.

entries.title: Australia releases cloud security guides for SMBs
entries.description: Australian Cyber Security Centre unveils several guides to help small and midsize businesses safeguard their cloud infrastructures and against common cybersecurity incidents.

entries.title: Low-code development: Here's how it's being used
entries.description: IT shops have plenty of choice when it comes to low-code platforms, which can address resource shortages in some aspects of application development. However, low-code also has its limitations.

entries.title: Alibaba Cloud eyes Web3 potential, participation on Singapore government cloud
entries.description: Chinese cloud vendor will introduce a blockchain node service next quarter as it pushes ahead with its Web3 strategy and is keen to play a role on Singapore's roadmap to move its government services to commercial clouds, which currently encompasses Amazon Web Services, Google, and Microsoft.

entries.title: Three-quarters of developers are willing to quit for a new job. And it's not just about the money
entries.description: Salary matters, but it's not the only motivation to look for a new job.

entries.title: The Insignia 24" smart Fire TV just dropped to less than $80 on Amazon
entries.description: Smart TVs always drop in price around Christmas, but an $80 smart TV isn't a deal to be ignored.

entries.title: Artificial Intelligence could steal your restaurant job. Here's how
entries.description: The food and beverage industry is experiencing a digital transformation, as robots and AI-powered tools fill in the gaps caused by a labor shortage.
